700034f-a.title: Bronx: 134th Street (East) - Alexander Avenue
700034f-a.text:
East 134th Street, north side, east from Alexander Ave., to the Third Ave. Elevated Line (between Alexander and Willis Aves.), showing the cleared area where the westerly approach to the
Triborough Bridge is being constructed.
July 29, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

700035f-a.title: Bronx: 134th Street (East) - Alexander Avenue
700035f-a.text:
(1)
East 134th Street, north side, west from but not including Alexander Ave., showing the clearance created for the construction of the westerly approach to the Triborough Bridge. Several hundred old tenements were rased to make way for the construction of the
bridge approach.
July 29, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a point slightly westward at Lincoln Ave.
July 29, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view northeastward across the clearance st East 134th Street and Lincoln Ave. The houses face on the north side of East
135th Street, extending east from Lincoln Ave.
July 29, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

700398f-a.title: Bronx: Alexander Avenue - 134th Street (East)
700398f-a.text:
Alexander Ave., north from East 134th Street across the clearance for the westerly approach to the Triborough Bridge between East 134th and East 135th Streets. In the center background appears the St. Jerome Roman Catholic Church at the S.E. corner of East
138th Street.
July 29, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
